com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers
Class AbstractOutputStreamWriter

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.AbstractWriter
      com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.AbstractOutputStreamWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Writer
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileWriter, OutputStreamWriter, ResponseWriter
public abstract class AbstractOutputStreamWriter
extends AbstractWriter

Writes to an output stream. When an object is being written, one of the following things happens:

  • When the object is a byte array, it is written to the output stream as-is;
  • In any other case, the object is being converted to a string and the bytes in that string are written to the output stream.
Subclasses have to implement a single method: one that creates an output stream.

An output stream writer optionally implements buffering; in that case, a buffered output stream is used to write objects to. Regardless of whether an abstract output stream writer buffers or not, clearing it is not supported.

Creates the output stream that should be used. This method is invoked when the output stream is first needed.

Returns:
the output stream that should be written to
Throws:
WriterException - when the output stream can't be created

flush

public void flush()
           throws WriterException
Description copied from interface: Writer
Flushes everything that has been written to this writer. If there's nothing to flush, nothing will happen. If this writer wraps another writer, the underlying writer will be flushed as well.

Specified by:
flush in interface Writer
Overrides:
flush in class AbstractWriter
Throws:
WriterException - when this writer is closed or when something goes wrong while flushing

close

public void close()
           throws WriterException
Description copied from interface: Writer
Flushes and closes this writer. If this writer wraps another writer, that writer will be closed as well.

After a writer has been closed, it can no longer be used.

Specified by:
close in interface Writer
Overrides:
close in class AbstractWriter
Throws:
WriterException - when this writer can't be closed or has already been closed
